Tech Experience

As a high school senior, I'm involved with the tech industry by participating in summer coding programs and volunteering. As an aspiring computer scientist, I seek experience. Contact me at ocobas19@avenues.org. I design websites and build computers for clients for free or cheap (less than $25).

Today’s Teens, Tomorrow’s Techies:

Intern (11, 7 hrs/wk, 24 wks/yr)

  • Helped organize library events, educated patrons about technology resources, filmed a video series teaching future patrons basic computer skills.
  • Assisted co-workers by troubleshooting more advanced technology problems, applying skills learned in training workshops
  • Filmed and wrote a 10-part video series teaching basic computer skills to future patrons
  • Designed and distributed posters about library events
  • Maintained and cleaned technology
  • Restocked printer paper
  • Reshelved books
Electives (11, 4 hrs/wk, 5 wks/yr)
  • iOS Game Creation Class (4 hrs/wk, 4 wks/yr):
    • Created an endless runner game using Swift
  • Photoshop Class (4 hrs/wk, 1 wks/yr):
    • Learned and applied advanced PhotoShop skills to create a digital poster
  • Summer Training Program (Summer 10, 20 hrs/wk, 2 wks/yr):
    • Received advanced training in Microsoft, Excel and PowerPoint
    • Learned to navigate BPL Catalog and Databases
Engineering Club (12, 2 hr/wk, 40 wks/yr):
  • Co-Founder of Engineering Club
  • Expose and expand interest in engineering by planning out weekly engineering competitions and activities, and organizing workshops on different tools in the Fabrication Lab
  • Created curriculum for weekly meetings
  • Led coding workshops
All Star Code (Summer 11, 40 hrs/wk, 6 wks/yr):
  • Developed coding and soft skills alongside other young men of color, a personal portfolio of projects and a website that helps teens get into college.
  • All Star Code is a nonprofit computer science education organization focused on motivated Black and Latino young men
  • 1 of 2000 accepted into the Cisco cohort
  • Learned technical skills - HTML/CSS, JavaScript, Flexbox, CSS Grid, Fetch, JSON, p5.js and fundamental computer science concepts
  • Attended workshops on public speaking, communication, software engineer interview skills, money management, resume and college planning
Demo Day (40 hrs/wk, 1 wk/yr)
  • College Start is a website that help high school students find scholarships, colleges and opportunities (Jobs, Internships and Summer Programs) https://omarasc5.github.io/College-Start/
  • Worked in a team of 5 as a backend developer:
    • Worked on the login/logout and create account features
    • Created a database storing user data
    • Connected our group’s code
  • Pitched, prototyped and presented College Start on Demo Day to parents and Cisco developers
5th Term Mastery: Design and Engineering (11, 19 hrs/wk, 4 wks/yr):
  • Collaborated with other coders, artists and musicians to program and present a video game based on my school community, Elevator Run.
  • Designed and programmed a video game based on the Avenues Community, Elevator Run
    • https://omarasc5.github.io/Elevator-Run/
5th Term: Robotics Team (10, 20 hrs/wk, 4wks/yr):
  • A part of 10-person team that designed a 100-pound robot that collected balls from the floor to launch them in the air
  • Helped build the chassis of the robot. Helped diagram and build a ramp that collects balls off the ground.
  • Helped diagram, design and build a ramp that collects balls off the ground
